articles.title: OpenAI-backed biotech firm Chai Discovery raises $130M Series B at $1.3B valuation
articles.description: Chai is building foundation models for drug discovery, specifically to predict interactions between molecules so they could be reprogramed for cures.
articles.author: Lucas Ropek

articles.title: I hate that I love Riverside’s AI-driven ‘Rewind’ for podcasters
articles.description: Riverside's year-end review is amusing, but it represents a creative culture that's increasingly entwined with AI.
articles.author: Amanda Silberling

articles.title: Disney’s OpenAI deal is exclusive for just one year — then it’s open season
articles.description: After the one year is up, Disney is free to sign similar deals with other AI companies.
articles.author: Aisha Malik

articles.title: Nvidia bulks up open source offerings with an acquisition and new open AI models
articles.description: Nvidia acquired SchedMD, the lead developer of Slurm, and launched the Nemotron 3 family of open source AI models.
articles.author: Rebecca Szkutak

articles.title: Ford is starting a battery storage business to power data centers and the grid
articles.description: Ford will invest about $2 billion into the new business over the next two years.
articles.author: Sean O'Kane, Kirsten Korosec

articles.title: Ford’s next F-150 Lightning will have a gas generator as it pivots away from large EVs
articles.description: The company is abandoning plans for a brand new all-electric pickup truck codenamed "T3" and ending production of the battery-only Lightning.
articles.author: Kirsten Korosec, Sean O'Kane

articles.title: Creative Commons announces tentative support for AI ‘pay-to-crawl’ systems
articles.description: The organization offered support for this idea of an AI marketplace, and suggested several guiding principles.
articles.author: Sarah Perez

articles.title: Lightspeed raises record $9B in fresh capital
articles.description: The massive fund haul will allow the Silicon Valley firm to continue to invest in cash-hungry AI startups.
articles.author: Marina Temkin

articles.title: Merriam-Webster names ‘slop’ the word of the year
articles.description: AI-generated content has dominated the internet over the past year, and America's dictionary took note.
articles.author: Lucas Ropek

articles.title: Google’s ‘dark web report’ feature will no longer be available starting in February
articles.description: Launched initially about a year and a half ago, this tool aimed to help users monitor their personal information on the dark web.
articles.author: Lauren Forristal

articles.title: Gift guide: TechCrunch’s favorite things
articles.description: As tech journalists we have a lot of opinions. So if we really like something, it's probably good!
articles.author: Amanda Silberling, Aisha Malik

articles.title: Threads adds new communities, tests badges for highly engaged members
articles.description: Threads, which has more than 150 million daily active users, adds more communities to its platform.
articles.author: Ivan Mehta

articles.title: Lidar-maker Luminar files for bankruptcy
articles.description: The filing marks the end of a tumultuous year full of layoffs, executive departures, and piling debts.
articles.author: Sean O'Kane

articles.title: Zoom brings its AI assistant to the web with access to free users
articles.description: Zoom is allowing free users to try its AI assistant in limited capacity.
articles.author: Ivan Mehta

articles.title: Netflix responds to concerns about WBD deal
articles.description: Industry concerns over Netflix acquiring Warner Bros. has led executives to address fears regarding jobs and theatrical releases.
articles.author: Lauren Forristal

articles.title: Facebook Messenger’s desktop app is no more
articles.description: The app remains usable via the web, Facebook app, and through the mobile app for iOS and Android.
articles.author: Sarah Perez

articles.title: Tesla starts testing robotaxis in Austin with no safety driver
articles.description: It's one of the last big steps before the company can truly claim it's operating a robotaxi service, and start to take on Waymo.
articles.author: Sean O'Kane

articles.title: Snapchat rolls out its end-of-year Recaps
articles.description: The Recap is a short video that offers a personalized look at highlights from Snaps, Stories, and Chats, showing how users connected and expressed
articles.author: Aisha Malik

articles.title: First Voyage raises $2.5M for its AI companion that helps you build habits
articles.description: First Voyage has raised $2.5 million in a seed funding round from a16z speedrun, SignalFire, True Global, and other investors.
articles.author: Dominic-Madori Davis

articles.title: How iRobot lost its way home
articles.description: iRobot survived three decades of competition, but couldn't survive European regulators killing its Amazon buyout. Now it's being taken over by its
articles.author: Connie Loizos

articles.title: WhatsApp’s biggest market is becoming its toughest test
articles.description: Meta has three months to comply with Indian government directions that could affect how WhatsApp operates in the country.
articles.author: Jagmeet Singh
